intro: Impatiens pseudoperezii subsp. bengkulensis, commonly known as the Bengkulu impatiens, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Indonesia. It belongs to the family Balsaminaceae and is characterized by its delicate, showy flowers that typically bloom in shades of pink and white. The plant is herbaceous, with opposite, ovate leaves that are often covered in a fine pubescence. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest undergrowth. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endemic species within its range.
